lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.text: What did Isaac send Esau to go do?
answers: Hunt for some food for his father to eat
Find a wife in a faraway land
Go gather wood for a sacrifice
Take the animals out to the fields

questions.text: What was Isaac going to give to Esau after the meal?
answers: The special blessing of God
A new robe and a new bow
Half of his riches and flocks
A message to deliver to Rebekah

questions.text: Why was getting this blessing a big deal?
answers: It came with all the promises God made to Abraham and Isaac
It made the son very tall and strong
It meant he would never have to work again
It proved Esau was better than Jacob

questions.text: What tricky plan did Rebekah come up with?
answers: To have Jacob pretend to be Esau and take the blessing
To send Esau far away for many years
To make Isaac fall asleep
To trick Jacob into leaving home

questions.text: What did Jacob do to fool Isaac?
answers: Wore Esau’s clothes, wore goat fur, lied
Stood far away so Isaac couldn’t see him well
Pretended to have lost his voice
Asked Esau to help him trick Isaac

questions.text: What did Isaac say when Jacob spoke?
answers: The voice is Jacob’s, but the hands are Esau’s
Who are you, stranger?
You do not smell like Esau
You must be tricking me

questions.text: When did Isaac finally believe Jacob was Esau?
answers: After smelling him
After touching his face
After hearing him speak again
After tasting the food a second time

questions.text: After eating Jacob’s food, what did Isaac do?
answers: Gave Jacob the blessing of God
Asked for more food
Told Jacob to leave the tent
Fell asleep

questions.text: When Esau came in with his food, what did Isaac say and do?
answers: “Who are you?”, he started shaking
He was happy and blessed Esau too
He laughed and thought it was funny
He sent Esau away without speaking to him

questions.text: How did Esau feel about what Jacob did? What did Esau plan to do?
answers: Angry, he planned to kill him
He forgave Jacob right away
He planned to move far away and forget about it
He wanted Isaac to punish Jacob
